text: hi everyone Anthony Fantana here the
Internet's busiest music nerd and it's
time for a review of the new Skrillex
album recess Skrillex is an electronic
music producer most known for being a
leading figure in the rising popularity
of noisy drop centric dubstep aka
brostep love him blindly as an EDM
fanatic or hate his guts as a slightly
snobbish fan of more refined genres of
electronic music Skrillex is rise to the
top has made him a pretty polarizing
figure and I personally have never
really even hated his sound right from
the first moment I ever heard it on his
scary monsters and nice sprites EP a
handful of years ago at the time when I
dropped my review of that EP I was
actually pretty surprised at some of the
negative reactions to my positive
feelings on the thing and while drops
and very noisy bass frequencies do play
a pretty huge role on the songs from
this EP a production technique that a
lot of people equate to pure buffoonery
these days I personally not only enjoyed
that but saw beyond that to see a lot of
very jittery detailed rhythms I loved
the fact that these tracks always seem
to be shifting and sound and groove and
also brought a lot of color and texture
to the table I thought a lot of tracks
on the CP were fun energetic
hard-hitting and detailed too however
even though I do like what Skrillex was
doing here I'm not ready to really
defend every move he's made in
mainstream music since then for one
there were a few potholes on his
bangarang EP even though I think he did
come through with some of his hardest
bangers yet on that thing did not really
care for the Dores track they're also
really didn't dig Skrillex's work on the
dubstep infused Korn album path of
totality and he actually dropped an
incredibly weak EP last year titled
leaving where out a few tracks here if
felt like Skrillex was trying to emulate
the airy more atmospheric more subtle
sounds of underground tone down dubstep
producers like burial and while in a
sense taking on these sounds felt Cincy
it really sort of came up short in terms
of being as entertaining as some of
those artists so last week out of the
blue Skrillex decides to just drop his
debut full-length album with this kind
of tacky alien cover and title however
as far as party music goes I feel like
you could do a lot worse the Skrillex so
I didn't go into this thing with maybe
the same level as anxiety some of the
people who hate listen to this thing did
I'm sure but for Skrillex what I think
this record comes down to essentially is
versatility versatility he's really
pushing himself on this record to work
with a variety of artists and musical
styles incorporating his typically loud
drop centric heavy party-ready sound to
different styles of music he's really
pushing himself on this record to work
with a variety of different artists and
sounds seeing how many different places
he can take his typically loud heavy
production style and apply it you know
to different genres and sometimes it
seems like he's taking just a really
weird
sonic detour as well I think this is
maybe his least cohesive record yet I
don't think there's a whole ton of
strings these tracks together and I
would say the single power of this
record isn't quite as strong as it was
on some of Skrillex as earlier releases
as well I think the closest Skrillex
comes to dropping a track of that
intensity of that quality is rageh bomb
with the ragged twins
I love the distorted vocals all over
this track their really attention
forcing the groove on the song is
fantastic and the drop is insane the
eerie synth arpeggios that float
throughout this tracks at a really nice
tone and I love the way that the bass
and the rhythm sort of go double-time
toward the end of the track I love the
song but Skrillex doesn't really
concentrate on churning out a massive
banger with each track on this thing
which like I said earlier does leave
this LP feeling less
heesu than previous projects but I guess
it's sort of a silver lining in a way
that you know nothing kills an albums
listen ability like taking a great idea
and then just copying it 10 or 12 times
instead he brings a lot of variety which
does lead to some hit or miss tracks
like usual Skrillex does deliver some
heavy dubstep bangers with some ear worm
vocal samples or contributions maybe
some bright screaming synth leads as
well like on the track try it out or the
song recess - although the incessant
vocal samples on this track of put your
hands and weed okay and the fake crowd
noises on this song making a sound like
the song is being performed live or
being played to a crowd or something
like that it really kills what little is
enjoyable about the rhythm and they're
really sweet just candy candy sweet
vocal samples on this track and there's
another track on here that features the
ragga twins as well the opening track on
here all is fair in love and brostep a
song that unfortunately while it does
embrace all the tenants of brostep that
we have come to expect from a guy like
Skrillex it's just kind of an
inconspicuous sort of average song for
school unfortunately however there are
tracks on here where he does show that
he has some tricks up his sleeve and
he's not just a one-trick pony for one
the song stranger a pretty chilly
subdued piece of dance pop that has a
really great vocal contribution on it I
love the melody on this track the vocal
melody that is however the beat the
groove just the overall tone of the song
seems like it is the result of having
listened to our upon hour upon hour of
the new disclosure record settle with
the very choppy groove in the background
on this track and the boyish lead vocals
I think this song might have fit pretty
snugly into settles tracklist along with
the song [ __ ] that too and even though
the influence on this track seems really
a parent I think Skrillex puts his own
play on this thing once the heavier
drums come into play and he throws this
absurdly squeaky ridiculous synth lead
over the track that as weird as it sound
I think I love it it's great the song
coast is clear has chance the rapper
which is another huge surprise on this
LP and while lyrically the song is
pretty trashy it is really surprising to
hear Skrillex come through with an
instrumental that complements chance so
well and sounds like something straight
out of the acid rap mixtape that came
out last year except maybe a little bit
louder brighter punchy er featuring the
kind of dubstep rhythms that we
typically expect from Skrillex and then
there is sort of a surprise remix on
this track of the Nicki and the dub song
DJ ease my mind which is titled ease my
mind on this record and while I think
the song is really great I loved hearing
it on the record that they put out a
little while ago I don't really see what
Skrillex does with the track here other
than just sort of make it more
appropriate to play in the midst of a DJ
set other than that in my opinion he's
really added nothing to the track and
made a really great song a lot less
dynamic than it originally was but my
least favorite of all of the surprise
tracks on here easily is the song dumpy
pump a really dinky piece of glitchy
electronic music that has these just
weird
cartoony sound effects in it that sound
like they were lifted off of just like a
general sfx CD or something like that
it's colorful but the pace of is really
slow there's nothing much about it
that's all that memorable and it kind of
creates this very unnecessary
intermission toward the back end of the
album as nice as it was to hear Skrillex
just go down some different avenues on
this record I mean the songs were he's
experimenting the most are among my
least favorite here unfortunately while
I think the more heavy brostep tracks on
this record are sort of average for him
they were at least passable for the most
part I mean the song that he has Diplo
on dirty vibe is this fantastic piece of
moombahton
with this killer rhythm high-energy and
I love the insane vocal sampling on this
track and as the vocals are being
sampled the the crazy paradiddles that
are being played with them and I love
the way these trap high hats fly in as
some of the rap
versus start on this track its its
highlights like this that for sure will
have me coming back and listening to
each new Skrillex release at least into
the near future just to see if there's
some killer bangers in the playlist and
I think Skrillex could potentially
continue going down that road if he
brings these bangers together onto an EP
and is just sort of concise with his
releases and isn't putting a lot of
filler onto them and unfortunately I
feel like that's kind of what we got
with this record while it does show that
Skrillex is a more versatile producer
than I think a lot of people give him
credit for you know he really does kind
of push himself out of his comfort zone
proving that he can do one thing do
another thing do another thing I think
he's considerably far away with all the
potholes in the tracklist on this thing
from putting out one of his better
releases I'm feeling a decent two strong
five on this thing transition if you've
given this record a listen what did you
think of it did you love it did you hate
it why what do you think I should review
next and that's about it
Anthony Fantana music review forever
